description: Array read by antidiagonals with T(n,k) = min(n,k).
comments: Also, "correlation triangle" for the constant sequence 1. - _Paul Barry_, Jan 16 2006Antidiagonal sums are in A002620.As a triangle, row sums are A002620. T(2n,n)=n+1. Diagonal sums are A001399. Construction: Take antidiagonal triangle of MM^T where M is the sequence array for the constant sequence 1 (lower triangular matrix with all 1's). - _Paul Barry_, Jan 16 2006Zeta[2,k/p]+Zeta[2,(p-k)/p]=(Pi/Sin[(Pi*a(n))/p])^2, where p=2,3,4, k=1..p-1. - _Artur Jasinski_, Mar 07 2010From _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 25 2011: (Start)As a triangle, count up to ceiling(n/2) and back down again (repeating the central term when n is even).When the first two instances of each number are removed from the sequence, the original sequence is recovered.(End)
